rows.THE MC — MASTER OF CEREMONIES: The face of every TUP. The person who talks through every project by asking the obvious questions.
WHAT THE MC IS
The MC is not a VA. Not an actor. Not a host reading a script.
The MC is the person who sits with every person working on every project
and has the conversation a smart outsider would have.
'What does this mean?'
'Why are we doing it this way?'
'What happens if this doesn't work?'
'Can you explain that like I'm not in this industry?'
'So what are we actually doing this week?'
The MC doesn't need to understand the Trade. They need to NOT understand it.
Their ignorance is the product. Their questions are what force clarity.
The conversations get recorded. They live on the site. They ARE the content.
They're also the institutional knowledge capture — because they document
WHY decisions were made, not just what was decided.
WHAT THE MC DOES
PRIMARY: 4-10 hours of recorded conversations per model/TUP.
For each model, the MC sits with whoever is working on it and talks through:
• What is this model about? (The MC asks, the expert/PM/operator explains)
• What's the plan? (Walk through the tabs, the timeline, the milestones)
• What are the hard parts? (Where are the risks, unknowns, disagreements?)
• What did we learn? (After expert sessions, after production, after launch)
These conversations serve FIVE purposes simultaneously:
1. LEGIBILITY — If the MC can understand it, anyone can understand it.
If the MC is confused, the plan isn't clear enough yet.
2. CONTENT — The recordings are the site's primary content.
Not polished productions. Real conversations. Cinematic quality audio/video
but raw, unscripted content.
3. ESSAYS — The MC asking 'what is a Compliance Manager and why do we need one'
IS the essay explaining the novel concept. Transcribed, it becomes the IP tab.
4. INSTITUTIONAL KNOWLEDGE — Every decision, every rationale, every disagreement
is captured. New team members watch the conversations to onboard.
5. INVESTOR PROOF — Investors watching these conversations see a real team
working through real problems in real time. More compelling than any deck.
WHO THE MC INTERVIEWS
Everyone. The MC talks to every person in the system about their domain:
• Nilo — The thesis. Why this exists. The coordination hedgefund. The vision.
• PM co-founder — The plan. What's happening this week. What's working.
• Experts — Their domain. What the AI got wrong. What good looks like.
• Product Person — The site. Design decisions. What they're building and why.
• CoS — The raise. Investor conversations. What investors are asking.
• Operators — When they join. Who they are. Why they said yes.
• Future hires — As cast members join. Introduction conversations.
The MC is the connective tissue. They're the only person who talks to
EVERYONE about EVERYTHING. That makes them the best-informed person
in the system after Nilo — and their understanding is the baseline
for what external audiences can understand.
MC QUALITIES
• Curious — Genuinely wants to understand, not just going through motions
• Attractive on camera — Camera presence, someone you want to watch
• Comfortable with not knowing — Willing to say 'I don't understand, say that again'
• Good listener — Follows up on the interesting thing, not the next question on a list
• Articulate — Can summarize what they just heard back to the person cleanly
• Consistent — Shows up every day. This is a rhythm, not a performance.
• Warm — People enjoy talking to them. Interviewees open up, don't perform.
Think: podcast host energy. Joe Rogan asking a physicist to explain black holes.
The MC doesn't need to be the smartest person. They need to be the most curious.
THE MC IS ALSO THE ADMIN
The MC is not just on camera. They're also the operational backbone.
Between interviews, the MC handles:
• Scheduling conversations (owns the calendar for all recorded sessions)
• Uploading content to the site (CMS updates, video uploads, summaries)
• Screening candidates (first filter for every role in the labor chain)
• Filing paperwork (entity formation, admin tasks PM co-founder delegates)
• Managing the cast page (updating who's in, who's open, photos/bios)
This is the VA work. But framing it as 'MC who also does admin' is different
from 'VA who also does videos.' The identity is MC first. The admin supports it.
Total time: ~6-8 hours/day.
3-4 hours: recorded conversations (1-2 sessions per day)
2-3 hours: admin, scheduling, site updates, candidate screening
1 hour: daily video summary (the 60-90 sec update synthesizing today's conversations)
COMPENSATION
This is a real job. Not a gig. Not a favor.
Options:
• Full-time contract: $2-4K/month (depending on location/experience)
• Equity: 1-3% in IonWave (vesting over 12 months)
• Content rights: MC can use all content in their own portfolio/reel
• Title: MC of IonWave (or whatever the DAO/series name becomes)
The pitch:
'You're the host of a new web series documenting a company being built in real time.
4-10 hours of conversations per week. You interview everyone from the founder to
the experts to the investors. Cinematic quality. Your face is the brand.
You also run the admin. Think: podcast host meets executive assistant.
Equity from Day 1. If this works, you're the face of a portfolio of companies.'
